sentences.en: Celia had decided long ago she would never temporize on that.
sentences.cn: 西莉亚早就认定,在这上面她绝不能妥协.

sentences.en: She would balance and temporize endlessly before reaching a decision.
sentences.cn: 她在做出决定前会不断地犹豫观望和见风使舵.

sentences.en: They are still temporizing in the face of what can only be described as a disaster.
sentences.cn: 眼看着灾难来临，他们还在拖延时间。

words.tran_cn: 姑息者；骑墙主义者；顺应时势者；见风使舵的人
顺应时势；迎合潮流；妥协；拖延（等于temporize）
拖延；妥协；顺应时势；迎合潮流

trans.tran_en: to delay or avoid making a decision in order to gain time

trans.tran_cn: 敷衍，拖延，顺应时势，暂时同意
